poem:
**August Economics**

In the slip of August sun,  
growth whispers, a fleeting breath—  
yet beneath, a widening rift.  
In the quiet halls,  
where hopeful footsteps  
once promised permanence,  
now echo the fall of statistics—  
numbers,  
slumping like leaves,  
drifting into the widening  
trade winds.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Hays has reported a 14% drop in net fees in the third quarter of this year, compared with 2023, including a 20% drop in the UK and Ireland. Revenue from finding permanent candidates fell faster". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
